text: Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, grass and grains. Flavor was clean and crisp with citrus, fruit, grass, grain, and had a light bitterness.
50cl bottle from cervezalandia. Cloudy dark gold. Thin persistent white head. Light sweetness. Medium bitterness. Aroma is light hop, cereal, malt, light DMS but acceptable.

Bottle pour into tulip glass from One Stop Market. Aroma is mild cereal from the Munich and Pilsner malts. Appearance is hazy light yellow with nice sparkle, quickly-dissipating 1/2 finger width white head with nice lacing. Taste is light malt, German yeast. The hops seem to contribute more to the bitterness than flavor. Palate is light bodied with average texture, lively carbonation and dry finish. Overall, true to style as very drinkable but not very flavorful or memorable.
Poured from bottle hazy bronze with a nice white head. Aromas of grass grain malt and sweet bread. Taste is nice balanced and decent beer.
Bottle from Beers of the World, Henrietta. Crisp lagery aroma. Nice c-hop taste combined with a lager finish. Peachy notes too.

355 ml bottle @ Timo A.
Pours hazy color with a small head. Pine and apricot on the nose, some mild grassy hints, barley tones, pale malts and mandarin. Flavor is fruity and pale malty, herbal tones. Simple.
3323
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2016 Bottle at home. Aroma is malt, grain, a slight herbal note, hint of fruits. Flavour is almost moderate bitter. Body is light to medium. A tasty Lager!
Light smoke and some very nice malt. Note of noble hops. Good grain. Light snappy finish. Tap at brewpub.

This was poured into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a slight hazy bronzed yellow color with a fast rising carbonation rising to fill a two finger white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Lacing was mainly speckled in a messy sort of way.
The smell started off with sweet freshly cut grass running into slight sweet citrusy notes.
The taste was moderately grassy sweet. A dry sweet semi-grassy aftertaste slides into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation runs really light for this one. Im not minding that. A sweet sticky dryness clings to my tongue nicely.
Overall, this was a pretty nice American Pale lager that I would have again and definitely would be nice with its respected food.

A 12 fl oz bottle with no bottled on date and poured into a pint glass. It poured a slightly hazy golden colour with a light one finger white head that dissipates to a foamy layer with only very light lacing. Aromas are bready malts, pine and some light citrus orange peel, lemon and lime. Tastes grassy, honey and brown sugar sweetness, caramel and bready malts, corn and light hop bitterness. Creamy, light bodied with medium carbonation. Im not normally a lager person, but Jacks Abby are definitely changing my views and showing me what can actually be done with lagers. In this case, Jacks Abby has produced another lager that would better most, but still falls a little flat.

Bottled 12oz (Firmabier)
Hazy yellow color, small white head. Grainy malty aroma, hints of citrus. Light-bodied. Grainy, citrus fruity flavor. Kind of organic lager feeling. Ok pale lager. My first one from this brewery.

The Kinsale. Boston

Reminds me of Augustiner Lager Hell. Super clean. Great use of malt. No sulphur or off-flavours

Aroma: grass, citrus
Appearance: hazy gold, white head
Taste: light bitterness, light sweetness
Palate: light body, slick feel, lively carbonation, abrupt finish
 Good brew
Pours an amber from the tap, good lacing, kind of a blandish, malty lager. Crisp. Good beer.

2 50cl bottles, shared with friends. Pours golden with small white head. Sweet aroma, mostly candy and fruits. Citrusy hops as well. The pilsner touch is fairly noticeable on the flavour, and there are also tangerine and orange notes. Really moderate bitterness, actually theres more sweetness on the palate than hops. Not cloying at all, by the way. Light/medium mouthfeel, good carbonation. Very sessionable.

Sweet malty aroma with some fruit esters. Dry and smooth. Crisp and malty with low bitterness. Nice drinking beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Six pack from Douglas. A clear light golden lager. Clean and crisp flavors. Light bodied. Not much to talk about here.

(bottle - 12 oz) Golden pour with a light fizzy head. Grass and light citrus in the aroma with a mild sweetness at the back. Flavor is a nicely balanced combination of grass, hops, floral notes, dry malt and a light citrus aftertaste. Good hot weather beer.

On Tap. Pours deep golden with white head. Aroma is of bready malt and citrusy hops. Body is medium and crisp. Citrusy, piney hops and bready malt fill the mouth. Finish is long and bitter. Nice, easy drinking lager.

On tap @Brewberry, A clear golden beer with medium head. Nose is on yeast and and ripped fruits, floral. Aroma is floral, light berries touch, yeast notes, bit watery, orange and quince notes, light wet paper touch, candied fruits at the finish, green herb notes.
Golden orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of bread, citrus, and hay. Bread and grain flavor upfront with some citrus mid-to back end. Nice refreshing beer.
Pours gold with a large white frothy head. Aroma is grass, wet hay, bread and touch of citrus. Taste is mild bitters with a crisp finish. Light bodied and a perfect lawnmower beer.

Dorada clara, nubosa. abundante espuma blanca. Buen aspecto. Aroma bastante seco y herbal. En boca tiene una innegable base malteada, pero estamos ante una cerveza eminentemente seca y de fino lupulo. Sobre todo al principio. Herbal, eucalipto. y evoluciona al revés de lo que suele ser habitual mostrando su tono más dulce al final. Superbebible. Muy interesante.

Bottle from Whole Foods. Pours hazy dark straw with fluffy, off-white head. Nose is spicy yeast, orange marmalade, hops, malt. Tastes fruity, with apricot, peach, tangerine, some white pepper, hops, and funk.

Tap. Pours clear golden with nice white head. Aroma is very balanced between earthy hops, some citrus, and malt. Some bread. Taste is crisp and fresh. Very nice balance. Some elderflower and nice malty base.  Bitter finish with with some earthy spice. Slight dry. One of my favorite pilsner, so balanced!

Where and how:  PG Amherst / Bottle 355 ml.
Aroma front reminded me of good old school Polish piwos, secondary vibe of citrusy floral hops. Very pleasant in character.
 Appearance :
Top: medium plus, lasting creamy, puffy cap.
Base: mild haze on gold, hinted with amber.
Palate :  medium full bodied, lighter carbonation, smooth body, slightly oily. Good malt work,
Taste: hoppy but not too much. Sesionable , drinkable deep golden lager. Balanced. Mild toasty, golden malt wrap things nicely.
 Other notes  yum

From a bottle into a snifter. Pours a really nice yellowish blonde. Real good depth of color. White head and a teensy bit of lacing. Not much aroma and slightly rancid..... Mouthfell is actually pretty luxuriant for a light beer with not too much alcohol. Slightly bockish. Taste is sweet with plums???? Very mild and not all that interesting. Eh. Not bad, not good.

Bonus from a recent trade. Toasty grain aroma. Flavor is a lote bit of the same with some grass and hay bitterness towards the finish. Nice lager with enough toastiness to remind you its a lager but a little more hops to make it interesting.

Poured a hazy deep gold with a thick, gradual dissipating head. I want to say the aroma had a blend of light bread malt and citrus. It has a nice soft, but crisp mouth feel. Flavor is a nice hop/malt balance with some subtle citrusiness and tartness. Its very smooth and tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 Golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, grains, grass, some cereal. Taste of much of the same, toasty, grassy hop bitterness, exceptionally quaffable.

12oz bottle.Clear golden body with a big, creamy and lacing white head. Weak aroma of malt with a light floral touch. Flavor is light, but very smooth malt, low bitterness and a hint of grassy/floral hops. Medium body and short aftertaste. Quite average lager with no faults, very soft and smooth but not particular exiting.
Bottle from SJ. This was a solid lager. Almost Herbal to a point, but not overbearing, Earthy / dirt, grass, lemon bread, grapefruit and salt. Interesting brew.
Pours a light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of biscuity malt, fruity yeast and caramel. Taste is light, malty, creamy with a crisp, fruity finish.
How: bottle Appearance: clear pale yellow, medium white head. Aroma; citrus, bread, caramel, floral. Palate: Light to medium body, average carbonation,

De color anaranjado. Luminosa, con una buena capa de espuma blanca de media retención.
Maltosa en nariz con algún toque cítrico.
Cuerpo medio y bien gasificada.
En boca la malta también toma protagonismo, con su punto dulce.
Refrescante, y para ver diferencias sólo tienes que probarla junto a una lager industrial.
4 oz pour on draft at Jacks Abby. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of biscuit, citrus. Tastes of biscuit, citrus, caramel, floral. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Many bottle and draft samples for as long as theyve been making it...Along with the 6 pack cans of CBCs Remain in Light, this is my current most enjoyed beer. Unbelievably well-balanced between hop flavor, hop bitterness, body and drinkability. Its got just enough bitterness to clear the palate and just enough body to keep you interested, but by and large this stuff is meant to be enjoyed en masse. Clean, crisp, bright, dry and wonderful. Writing this review makes me want to go drink some....Bravo for making such a high quality take on an oft-maligned "style".
Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear, dark gold with minimal head. Aroma of grains and some earthy hops. Taste follows, aroma more hop presence here. Pretty good.
Golden color little foam. The smell is earthy and sweetish as is the taste. This is a nice malty lager, but quite lagery and a bit boring.
Golden color with small white head. A surprisingly fruity aroma with sweet grains. Taste is sweet and fruity, with a nice malt body. Small-bubbled carbonation. A legitimately fine Lager.
Gylden brun noe tåkete med lavt beige skum. Eple, karamell og sitruslukt. Syrlig lett bitter smak. Grapefrukt og noe brent karamell. Kort. Medium kullsyre.

from Erzbierschof - clear golden beer with a little foam left; quite phenolic, hints of celeri, grass and ripe fruits below; moderate malt backbone; subtle carbonation, a light earthy bitterness; grassy and gently fruity finish - not convincing

Got in a BIF from ZebraCakez. 12 ounce bottle into lager glass, no bottle dating. Pours lightly hazy bright golden color with a 1 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, cracker, bread, herbal, floral, grass, light pine, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance of bright citrus/floral hops and light-moderate pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of grapefruit, lemon zest, orange peel, cracker, bread, herbal, floral, grass, light pine, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light herbal/grassy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, lemon/orange zest, cracker, bread, and herbal/grassy earthiness for a short bit. Very nice balance of bright citrus/floral hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a good malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. The finish has a good amount of dryness as well; and is very clean on lager flavor with zero yeast ester notes present. Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and slightly bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a damn nice pale lager style. All around great balance of bright citrus/floral hops and light-moderate pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.
A rather boring beer, but still much better than the commercial alternatives.
Clear yellow to orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is malt, hops, citrus, some caramel. Taste is sweet with mild bitterness. Soft carbonation, light to medium body, long sweet finish.

Pours an ultra clear light golden with a thin white head that wont stay or leave lacing. Nose is of citrusy hops, light nuts or at least husk and generally a mix between fruits and grains. Taste is moderately bitter and not really sweet while still being malty. Fresh cereals, citrus, tasty! Body is light and carbonat moderate, sessionable for sure! Pretty sure I havent had a better premium lager lately or even this year, these Jacks Abby guys know their stuff!

Im not experienced in session lagers, but this seems like a good one. Pours nicely with a fine head that lasts. Seems well balanced. Mild and light. Hint of citrus with something else creamy inside. Moderately carbonated.

A nice offering from Jacks Abby. I am trying more of their beer, but guess Im just not a lager person. I appreciate the work that went into this brew, and it is well crafted. Great balance between the bready malt and hops.

Pale golden, slight haze and a slight head. Light lemon, corkboard. Scratchy enough malt, fairly disruptive carbonation and low density bitterness. Passable enough, not overly offensive. Bottle, ScoIrl tasting
Bottle at Craigs...fairly boring...bit soft, slightly lactic...uninspiring but drinkable
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma of lager, caramel. Taste of bland lager. Clean and crisp.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale gold with a thin white head. Aromas of light lemon, malt. Taste is light malt. Ok.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy amber, nose is sweet toffee, light fruit, taste is dry, toffee, sweet, ok.
bottle at home .. ligth hazy amber ... big white head ... soft sweet grassy fruit...light hay nose .. soft citrus hay .. soft fruitsd

Bottle from Trader Joes, Cambridge. Drank it at home. Huge, chunky white head. Armoa is lemon dish soap and light funk. Light carbonation, oily texture, mildly hopped, light lemony overtones. Tastes like a kolsch.

DWF; Pours hazy golden with a moderate to large frothy, moderate lasting and lacing white head. Aroma is malt, hay, light citrus and light spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with a short to moderate lasting finish. Body is medium, texture is light to oily, carbonation is soft.

Keg @ Lord Hobo. Light gold with a small head. Light bread and syrup on the nose. Apple and treacle. Angel food cake. Taste of bready, crisp red apple. Honeyed graham cracker sweetness. Slight hoppy finish. Light body, soft carb.

12oz bottle. Pours a bright clear pale yellow, white head. Aroma is fresh grass, pale bready malt, hay. Flavor is pale pils malt & grassy hop. This stuff is the pale lager of legends, what folks have been trying to do with "lawnmower beers" for decades.
Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, grain, little nutty, grassy hops. Medium body, average carbonation. 181014
Bottle. Clear gold. Crisp, light, oaky surprisingly, a little sweet. Clean, crisp mouthfeel. Good stuff.
Bottle. Hazy gold with little head. Aroma is Play-Doh and flowers (in a good way). Taste is pretty standard lager with some nice hop bite. Thin crisp mouthfeel. Nice.

Bouteille. Paris Saint Bière. Robe dorée surplombée dune belle mousse blanche. Nez de malt blond aux notes noisettés avec une pointe de houblon. Bouche courte, légere et fluide au profile largement malté. La finale est légerement acide et florale. Une bière sans surprise mais une jolie lager.
Clear golden orange color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is toast, pale malt, light bread, light hop. Drinkable but compared to some of their other offerings I wasnt a fan.
Bottle courtesy of Greg Jasgur, thank you sir! Crystal clear golden color. Aroma of white & black pepper, fresh hay. Taste is clean, crisp, wow!.

Bottle. Pours a hazed golden color with a 2 finger creamy white head. Aroma is a pleasant mix of bready malt and light earthy hops. Light in body with a clean, refreshing lightly sweet flavor. Finishes dry. Real easy to drink.

Bottle poured a golden color with a thin coating of white head. Aroma has sweet lager malt, nice bright hops, fruity touches, and some grains. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation average. Flavor has a lager malt base, overlaid hops, some sweetness at the edges, and bits of grain. This is a well done lager with a great hop addition to kick it up.

Light orange colour, small white head. Aroma of peaches, quince, raisins, caramel. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter. LIght body, slick texture, average carbonation. Quite nice and drinkable.

Mild pine and citrus aroma. Pale amber color with some haziness. Head doesnt last long. Has an initial bitter bite but fades to a bland finish. Faint sweetness in background after awhile. Although not bad just not exciting for my taste buds.
Taster at the brewery. Medium gold. Malty nose, grains. Light grass and lemon hop. Lemony flavor, rich grain, nice palate. Ok. Light and drinkable but not so interesting.
Golden body and small head. Soft hops, moderate aroma of pale malts and tiny herbs. Its nice but I expected more. (33cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

Trade from Willrunforbeer - Thanks! Cloudy orange, thin white head. Smells nice, with biscuit - like malts and peppery, grassy hops. The flavor is pretty much the same, maybe a touch sweeter than the aroma would indicate. Nicely bitter finish. Nice stuff!
Bottle. Golden colour with an off-white head. Flavour and aroma is fruit, malt, hop, grain, citrus. Ordinary beer.

355ml bottle (Birofilia2014, Zywiec) (6-:3:6-:3:11=2.9--)
Fruity light grains. Pale, clear orange, small head. Simple malts, nice spicy hop bitterness. Refreshing crisp lager.
500ml bottle. Clear golden color. Small size, yellow head, stays. Dusty, grassy, faint hops, sweetish aroma. Weak aroma. Sweetish, faint grassy taste. Soft carbonation. Light body. Simple beer.

The Ruck, Troy tap: Pours pale gold with a white head. Aroma is light malt, bits of grass. and some light American fruity hops. Taste is very light, but has a very nice malt backbone. Really easy to drink. Nothing off. A very well put together session lager.

Pours a clear golden with a thick and fine-bubbled eggshell head. Aroma is mainly fruity, pear with some apple and a bit of banana, and a malty undertone. Flavor is fruity and a little malty, not bold but pleasing, with a bit of hops in the finish. Texture is rather fizzy and has about average thickness.

Bottle with thanks to BoostIPA. Pours clear straw with small white head. Aroma: fruity, a fair bit of caramel. Toast, faint apple juice and just a hint of sulfur. Taste: deeply toasted caramel malts, short lightly bitter finish. Light body, ample carbonation.

Big offwhite head. Clear coppery body with strong carbonation.
Raisiny malt aroma with watery honey notes. Dryish mealy watery
grainy taste with fruity notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, dusty
mouthfeel. Dry dusty watery grain aftertaste with strawy fruity
notes. Weird how they can brew something so watery at 4.5% with
such flavourful malt. Anyway, I felt this didnt work. There are
no off tastes, but the water really spoils it for me. (0.5l
bottle, from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen.)
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy pale golden coloured with a light floral and citrus flavour followed by slight pine on the creamy finish.

Solidność. W aromacie słodowo, bardzo czysto, lekkie nutki chmieli niemieckich. W smaku bardzo słodowe, treściwe, goryczka wyraźna, nic nie przeszkadza, jest pijalne i smakowite. Ideał stylu premium lager? Bardzo możliwe. Chciałbym to w każdym sklepie po 3 - 4 zł.

Hazy gold. Sturdy white head. Very fresh aroma, exactly what one should look for in a lager: balanced malts and hops in all their purity, no yeasty distraction save for the typical soft sulphur undertones. Even though its 20 IBUs are modest, this feels fairly bitter in a clean and lively way. The mouthfeel is crisp enough, but suffers slightly from the pointy, tongue-poking bubbliness, perhaps a bit over the top to really showcase the maltiness which is otherwise throughly enjoyably and not straight pale malts, there are bockish traits in there and a small, but fresh wheat character. Eminently drinkable, whih is its whole purpose, but also well-constructed, the malts not being completely straightforward yet working hands in hands with the lemony and flowery hops. Good stuff.

12oz or something sized bottle at Pizzeria Paradiso, thanks to Travlr via Bartender Greg. Poured a clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma was nice light pine, citrus (lemon, orange) notes. Crisp. Flavor was pretty nice caramel notes, pine, citrus - pretty darn enjoyable and unexpected. A "session lager" indeed.

Bottle bought @ bierkompass.de. Pours hazy golden with a frothy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is malty and tiny floral with biscuits, butterscotch, moist grass, persimmon, moss, St. Johns wort and straw. Taste is bitter, malty and tiny floral with dark bread, caramel, moist grass, persimmon, lemon zest, biscuits, moss and hints of butterscotch. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly dry and light bodied. Finish is bitter, malty and tiny floral with dark bread, caramel, moist grass, lemon zest, moss and straw. Solid stuff...

Draft. Pours dark yellow with thin white head that lingers. Medium carbonation over typical lager aroma. Decent enough but nothing remarkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Light golden, slightly hazy. Some white head.
Aroma: Hops, malt, summer (grass).
Taste: Nice bitterness, some malt and light fruits. Lingering aftertaste with hops. Great balance.
Bought: Erzbierschof, 500 ml, CHF 5.90
Info: 6/6-2014

Bottle. Pours somewhat hazy golden with a big creamy head. Aroma is sweetly roasted malts with an ever so slight whiff of smoke, as well as bread and honey and also nice spicy and citrusy hops with orange peel and some peach. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter, but fabulously balanced with roasted malts and bread. Nice lingering bitterness. Tremendous lager!

Bottle, 4.5%. Slightly hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, grainy, grass and hop. Flavous is malt, fruit, hop, grass, straw, little grainy, little sweet and a little bitter.
Sample at brewery. Light yellow pour with a white head. Nose is, well, not much going on in there. Taste is really nice, refreshing, some hops and a nice very light bitter finish.
Bottle at home. Medium high fluffy white lasting head. Cloudy light yellow body. Malt straww aroma. Heavily carbonated acidic malt flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness. Short finish.

Bottle. Left behind the bar for me at Beergeek by Tyson. God bless you Tyson. Youre a wonderful man. Drank at Riegrovy Sady. Pours slightly hazy Golden Amber with a White head. Nice clean lager with no skimping on hops. Grassy and refreshing. I can see why it conjures up fond memories of home.

Bottled. Pours clear and deep golden with an average, lacing, white head. Aroma of grain, grass and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carb. A nice Pils.
Golden pour from bottle. Some grainy malts and mild hops. A bit of character here,......
Pours a light orange. Aroma consists of cereal, with faint floral hop notes. Rather sweet and malt forward.

Bamberg joly day 2 25/01/2014. Bottle shared at Cafe Abseits. Thanks to Ronny. Aroma is berry, hedgerow hop with lemony edge and pine. Golden colour with a thin white head. Flavour is crisp lemony pine hop and clean pils malt. Palate is very clean with a crisp dry finish. Solid lager.
Bottle. A well made malt dominated lager with a modern hop profile that has a "european" feel to it (meaning not overhopped). Clean and drinkable.

Flaske, 50 cl @ hjemme. Gylden som korn, ok hvid skumhat. Nyslået græs, citrus, svovl, hø og lidt mere humlet i næsen end i selve smagen, der er lettere uinteressant - har fået bedre lager-øl fra Jabby Brau end denne.

Bottle.
Light but good taste of sweet malt, a slight twist of modern hops. An unfortunate hint of paper.

0.5l bottle. This one pours a blurry looking deep golden colored body with a medium sized lacing white top. Mild nose really. I get pale malts, some fair amount of grains and sweet wort. Also a hint of caramel. Fair enough I suppose. Its actually quite flavorful this. Is it a lager you say? Doesnt really taste like one. It has a slightly roasted element, lots of sweet sticky caramel and as mentioned its quite flavorful. Not particularly hoppy or bitter, just lots of flavor. It feels light oily in the mouth and its just below average on the carbonation. Sweet caramelly tail that lasts for a fair amount of time. Yeah, I have to admit that this was a really nice positive surprise. Both as sessionable and drinkable as they come. 12.04.2014

Bottle outside Khioskh. Clear amber liquid with a medium white head. Aroma of floral hops, bread, earth and red fruit. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of bread, floral hops and earth. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

Bottle... Hazy, lightly golden lager with a small, creamy, white head. Bready, biscuity, floral hop nose. Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Perfectly-balanced but thin and nearly flavorless. Finishes short, crisp and super clean. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!
Clear golden-amber with a small white head. Aroma is malt and toffee. Taste is toasted malt and a little bit caramel.

Deep yellow almost gold in color. The aroma is difficult to discern kind of a earthy hoppy aroma. Flavor starts hoppy but ends with a strong light roast malt flavor. Not every bitter but posses some complex flavors

Draft at The Ale House.
Appearance: Clear golden-amber body with a short white head.
Aroma: Light, clean and mildly malty. Hints of toffee and light fruit.
Taste: Clean and light with toasted malt, hints of apple and prominent caramel.
Palate: Clean light-medium bodied, highly carbonated.
Overall: Very easy to drink, a clean and refreshing lager with subtleties throughout.

Bottle from Matkroken Natland, Bergen. Pours a clear light golden body with a medium creamy white head. Nose is red berries, moss, peaches, grass and hints of pale malts and straw in the back. Unusual profile. Taste is red berries, melon, sweet grains and hints of straw. Light, oily body, soft to medium carbonation. Definitely one of the more original light lager creations Ive had, but I still feel its a bit too sweet and not quite in balance, somehow. Not too bad, though.

Bottle from erzbierchof - Clear dark golden color with decent white head good lasting and lacing - aroma is malty, grainy, floral hops - same for flavor - light body, light bitterness, crisp and dry, crisp malty finish - common lager nothing special
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av noe malt og humle. Smak av malt, honning og sitrus. Vaaland.
Duft av apelsin og honning. Dunkel gulbrun farge. Lite skum, liten ring langs kant. Smak av appelsin med en syrlig etersmak.
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig. Geschmack malzig, trocken. leicht fruchtig, getreidig, Stroh.

06.04.2014, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is very mild, hay, light malts, flowers, herbs, hints of grain and hops. Taste is slightly dry, hay, light malts, grain, hops, paper, hints of hops and weeds. Medium bitterness, slightly watery mouthfeel. Nice and easy drinking.

500ml bottle. Clear, deep golden colour with average to huge, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Pale malty aroma, minimally grainy, strawy, grassy overtones, a floral touch. Taste is initially grassy, slightly bitter hoppy, gives way to more floral notes with pale malty undertones. Above average relative to its style, all in all average and slightly boring.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is citrus, malt and grass. The flavor is very grassy and citrussy with a clean malty backbone. Very tickling. Bitter hoppy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 500ml. @ [ Fastelavn Smagning - Carnival Tasting, Ulfborg ]. [ As Jacks Abby Jabby Brau ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, hay, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140301]
Flaske: Lysegul let diset øl med et fluffy skumhoved. Duft af lagergær og humle. Fin mundfylde, lidt tynd. Smagen er udmærket men igen lidt tynd. Ok men ikke mere.

Poured from bottle into plastic cup: Pours golden with a thick, white head. Aroma of cracker malt, light floral hops, and pale malt. Taste is a nice malt rush that isnt at all sweet with a light hops bite at the end. Light to medium body, smooth finish, completely quaffable, I really like this.

Bottle from Vaaland, Bryne. Pours clear golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of marmelade with light citrussy notes. Taste is hoppy, american fruity hops, more fruits than bitteness, easy to swallow, easy all over.

Pours a slightly hazy gold body under a beautiful fluffy white head that had nice retention. The nose is clean and crisp with pale malt and light floral hops. The flavor is softly malty with some bready and crackery maltiness and just a touch of light bitterness from the floral hops. Light bodied and crisp with fine soft carbonation. Another winner from Jacks Abbey. Sessionable indeed.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a lager glass. There was no freshness date.

Appearance: Golden/honey hue. Mostly clear with a slight haze. Plenty of consistent carbonation visible. Pours to an average sized, off white, foamy head which laces and retains fairly well.

Smell: Slight citrusy aroma, but distinct dark malts as well. Mild nose though.

Taste: Its so hard to find a good, low ABV, craft lager these days. Jacks Abby is a brewery that specializes in craft lagers, so its not too surprising that theyd be able to pull off a truly sessionable, flavorful pale lager in the form of Jabby Brau. This is essentially an old school "Premium Lager," only done much better than the macro varieties.

The best way to describe the taste (and pretty much everything about this beer) would be taken verbatim from BJCP style guideline for category 1C. Ill paraphrase: Crisp and dry flavor with some nutty malt sweetness, maybe even some rustic graininess. Distinct hop presence here in the form of mild citrus and floral notes to give the beer true hop character without making it seem like anything other than the pale lager it is. There is some starchiness on the backend, though it leaves little aftertaste. Nothing quite amazing, but definitely impressive for a low gravity lager. 

Drinkability: This is exactly what you expect in a lager: the mouthfeel is on the thinner side, but not watery. Plenty of carbonation, though it goes down smooth and is thirst quenching. Its tempting to let this warm up to bring more flavor out, but I dont think its worth sacrificing the refreshing drinkability for just a bit more flavor. At only 4.5% ABV, Jabby Brau is indeed an American session beer, though you dont have to wait for warm weather to appreciate it.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with small white head. The aroma is fruity hop and yeast. Medium mouthfeel with light fruit hop, clean finish. Easy to drink, very good.

Bottle: Served in a shaker glass: Thanks Papsø:
Medium sized thick white foamy head on top of a cloudy yellow colored beer.
Aroma has lots of crispy floral tones, some grass, some hops, light citrussy. Easy, not revealing too much but a crispy loving wave to your nose!
Flavour is a crispy mix of floral tones, hops, herbs, bitter, light citrussy, some grassy tones and some light tints of malts and yeast.
Aftertaste is floral, bitter, light herbal, some hops, light hay. Yummi!
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied and a creamy texture.
Delicious, thirst clenching, easy but full of spirit! I like this a lot!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Bottle 500ml @ fonefan
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and floral. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Gylden klar skum hvid
Citrus malt 
Bitter modrate sød lidt 
Oile blød 
@f1

Bottle. An almost clear one, golden in color and with a small, dense, light beige head. The aroma is pretty boring, fruity and faintly malty, with citrus notes. The flavor is equally boring, but at least its far from bad. Pale malts in the back, with citrus hints, a generic fruityness and a fine bitterness. Medium body, a bit flat, semi-dry. Mostly hoppy finish. Easy drinkable this one, but thats about it. 140301
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, grass, straw and hops.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear yellow with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 010314
Bottle @ Beer Temple. Clear yellow golden color, full sized white head. Smell and taste malts, slightly grains, hay, nicely bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation. Ok beer.
Poured clear golden with a frothy off white head. Aroma oflactose and sweet grainy malt. Medium body, quite creamy, flavour of soft malt. Undemanding but nice.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours clear golden with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of grain, pepper, citrus. Taste is of grain, citrus, very faint bitterness, slight sugar. Palate: Medium-high carbonation. Dry, crispy. Light body. Pretty crafty balance. Overall: Very clean. Extremely drinkable. Outstanding pale lager. Very sessionnable. I think its of of those beers you need a copious sample to rate... fortunately.

6th February 2014Pretty much a clear gold beer, good white head. Palate is light and crispy. Very light pale malt, clean. Mild minerals. Very mild hop. Light dry finish. A clean lager but it wants another dimension.

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting at Café Abseits, during the Bamberg Jolly 2014.
Appearance: Amber colour with a quickly fading white head.
Aroma: Malt, citrus, fruit, hops, grass.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Slightly sweet, citrus, malt, grass.
Bottle from beeretrege. Clear yellow body with a medium white head. Nice and fresh. Hops, light malty, grain. Light bitter aftertaste.

Bottle shared with Linh, Minh and Angela. Pours a bright hazy orange with medium white head and nice soapy lacing. Aroma is faint hop, fruit and sweet malt. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of sweet bready malt, grassy hop, tea and fruit.

50cl bottle from ølbutikken dkk44. clear yellow, smooth white head.
aroma is flowery and slightly malty.flavor is flowery, euro lager, easy-drinking, slighthly flowery sweet lager. quite nice.
Bottle @ Odense Tasting Feb. 2014. Pours slight unclear golden with a white head. Lots of grass and a bit of yeast and biscuit. Wet grassy note. Certainly a quaffar - but with a mild unpleasant note.
Odense drinking Belgian Beer in February. Golden with a small white head. Aroma of grain and straw. Dry, malty flavour with spicy hops notes and a mild bitter finish
Bottle @ home It pours clear golden/amber with a medium white head malty, fruity, fresh, hoppy, light sweet, light bitter very well balanced. nice
gold pour, medium white head. mostly base malt with a light crisp citrus finish. gulpable and very sessionable.

(bottle, courtesy of rlgk) pours a murky golden coilour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy kiwi and peaches, with a hint of strawberries, vanilla and more sweet spices. flavour is mostly the same, lots of vanilla, caramel and some tropical fruit. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, Cafe Abseits Tasting bottle thanks to Ronny, 25/01/14. 
Lightly hazed orange amber with thin off white spotting.
Nose is fresh hops, caramel, bitter orange, bread dough, fruits.
Taste comprises bitter orange, light caramel, bready notes, hint of apricot.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying closure.
Decent lager, nice fruit depths.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. It pours clear golden with a medium white head. The nose is doughy, orange peel, sherbet and lemonade. The taste is crisp, doughy, grass, citrus peel and light sherbet, with a dry, lightly bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Crisp, balanced and utterly drinkable. Pretty delicious.

12oz bottle via BoostIPA, pours a slightly hazy golden with a large off-white head. Aroma of citrus oranges, hop spice, pils malt, and yeast. Taste of grain and malt with a well rounded citrus hop spice, and dry lager yeast. Clean, refreshing, very drinkable!

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a small, white head. Malty nose with hops being more floral than citrusy. Medium body, rather soft on the palate, a clean maltiness with a smooth hoppiness. Decent but nothing fancy. 290113

Bottle tasting at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg, during Jolly to Bamberg 2014. Clear golden beer with a small offwhite head. Malty aroma, fruity, hoppy, grassy, caramel, citrus, herbal notes. Malty grape flavor, grassy, citrus, hay, floral, mango, some floral notes.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a nice clear golden orange with a small off white head. The aroma is malty with dry bread crust and toast with light notes of citrus. The flavor is floral and bready with good earthy, citrus notes and bread crust near the finish. Light bodied but good flavor with a lasting finish. Really nice session lager.
Bottle at Cafe Abseits. Tasting. Hoppy like turkish delight. Lovely. Good beer. Super. Easy drinking soft

color dorado tirando a miel y espuma blanca ligera pero bien formada. Aromas de malta y flores. en boca es ligera, bien carbonatada y de textura sedosa. El inicio del trago es de malta y da paso a un amargor floral para terminar. Una lager ligera y muy rica.

500 ml bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Pours a hazy gold color with a nice frothy head that lingers nicely, nice lacing too. Aromas toasted sweet bread, grain, flowers, light honey, and light spice. Taste has a nice light honey sweetness, very little bitterness. Grainy malt with flowers and maybe a touch of citrus. Pretty tasty lager.

Aroma: Grainy Malts, Floral, Bready

Appearance: Amber/Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most light, Thin White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

Taste: Malty, Grainy, Floral, Mildly Citrus

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter

Bottle. Clear gold with a thin off white head that lasts, for what it is. Aromas of citrus, pine, grass, malt, and light spice. Flavor is the same with toasted malt and grain notes. Good citrus flavor balanced with the malt. Light bodied with a slight dry finish.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. The pour is orange amber mainly with a white head. Some haze. The aroma is a clean malt character but there is a decent citrus and apple feel. Toasted biscuit malts too. The body is light to medium. The taste is smooth, citrusy and clean. It fits the style.
Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Clean pale malty base, with faint floral hops and a crisp clean finish. Good stuff.

Bottle, bottle date 2013-09-13. Clear yellow golden with a large creamy white head, good retention and lace. Eggs, hay, grain, biscuit, light honey, light flowery. Light body, watery texture, medium carbonation. Light sweetness, light bitter and dry finish. Crisp and sessionable.

Bottle at Ungstrup.
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay, grain and hops.
Malty flavour of hay, grass and hops.
Hoppy finish.

Bottled. An amber beer with with a fluffy whitebhead. The aroma has notes of citrysy hops, spices, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, and hops, leading to a lightly bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a white head. Has a fruity malty spicy aroma with hoppy hints. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy finish.

Tap at Boynton, solid choice for an everyday beer, clean drinking premium lager with no adjuncts nothing to put off the masses and clean finish. light grain, light bread but not enough flavor to upset people.

Bottle at Mikkeller&Friends. Clear golden/amber - white head. Hay. Grassy. Light fruity. Dryness dusty. Light honey like notes. Fruity hoppy notes. Orange notes. Clean. But a bit too fruity - and some soap.

50 cl bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and citrusy, light pine note. Soapy. Peachy and citrusy. Bitter, crisp citrusy and lingering fruity finish.

Pale yellow with a little haze (hops?) and not much of a head. There are lots of the dank hop aromas Im starting to associate with this brewery, and also some light doughy malts. The hops become a little more citrus and grassy in the flavor, balanced by lightly sweet malt. Everything seems a little muted though, except for the alcohol profile which smells strong for a 4.5% beer. Light on the tongue, maybe a little under carbonated for the style.
Pours a light amber color, slight haze. Sweet malt, light fruity esters. Light, fruity, light citrusy, very refreshing.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow thin white head. Aroma is malt, bread. Taste is slightly sweet, bready, very light. Certainly drinkable.

Bottle. Pours clear golden amber with a small white head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is grain, grass, citrus, pine. Flavor follows suit - definitely has the lager thing going, but with a pleasant overtone of american hops. Light sweet, light bitter, light body. I would rather drink this than a Bud any day, but it doesnt hold up to the best IPLs (mostly also brewed by Jacks Abby).
Cloudy gold pour at GABF with a nice white head. Crisp and clean, flavorful, floral, malts, light honey flavors sneaking around. This is really nice.
500ml bottle @the dmac Monmouth Park Horserace Gathering-thin white-yellow. A-soft grain. T-soft spice hops, grain. Clean.

500mL thanks to WillRunForBeer! Pours a slightly hazy amber golden. Thick, white foam erupts with generous retention and thick lacing. Impressive appearance. Nose is German style sticky malt, detergent, fresh lemon, big soap...warming up it gets more of a honey grain and bread that I would hope for. Taste is suddy, pretty bland with hydrogen peroxide, mild biscuit density. Palate is highly carbonated on the tongue, but there isnt much malt body. Feels dull, drained. Disappointing. Still, drinkable and inoffensive.

On tap at Meadhall

Pours a golden color with a solid sheet of light cream foam. Smells of grassy and piney hops with some dry grain in the background. Flavor is cereal grains, slight bitterness, some nice grass hops and a little bit of butter underneath it all; well played. Medium bodied with tight, snappy carb and a semi dry finish. Nice beer. Like the ABV on it. 3.75/4/4/3.75/4

Aroma of floral hops and soapy malt. Cloudy orange with sand grain sediment. Bitter start, mellow sweet finish. Light body with a little snap. Great for sessions no doubt, also makes a good starter beer before a bigger offering.

From 10/29 notes. 500ml bottle pours clear light orange-gold with 2 finger head. Nose is subtle fruity spices, very faint citrus, and maybe a hint of banana. Mouthfeel is crisp carbonation, malt backbone, easy drinking. Taste is earthy orange, grain, rice, some lemon notes, malt. Finish is light bready malt, mild bitterness, with some subtle fruity and citrus notes. If Im going to drink a light lager it would be something like this. Good.
Growler from Premier Gourmet. Large foamy head on light yellow. For a premium pale lager, its very good. Very good drinkability. Not much aroma. Smooth mouthfeel.
draft at Blue Monk, solid, flavorful lager. medium bodied. easy drinking. touch of sweet maltiness, light bread. nice
Poured clear golden from a bottle, with medium white head. Has a good hop kick at the start and malts take over. Amazing they can get this taste from a lager.  Easy drinking beer medium body

Bottle shared by Steve at Billy Dregs tasting. Pours super hazy but bright golden with medium to large white head. Notes are toasty grain, flowers, orangey hops, fruity wheat, honey, caramel malt and lager hay. Very sessionable. Solid

Lightly hazy straw-yellow body, large white head and soapy lacing. Biscuits, light citrus, grass, and floral hops, toast, and grainy cereal. Medium to light bodied, lively carbonation, semi-sweet finish. Refreshing.

On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY. I really enjoyed this. Simple, light, easy to drink. A little bit of hops up front but a nice malt backbone, especially for such a light beer. Had a few Jacks Abby beers and this was the best of the bunch IMO.

pours clear bright gold with a thick white head. aroma has light maltiness...not sweet...and mild earthy hop tones...light toastiness and grass/herbs. flavor is very clean...mildly toasted malts and nice earthy hops...grass, spicy hops. mouthfeel is full and the finish is crisp and dry with earthy hops and a pleasant mineral water-like quality. very enjoyable!

I think I might need to try this again to get a better understanding of this beer. This sounds like a ridiculous statement for such a light and straightforward beer. However, simpler beers intended for session drinking are difficult to fully assess when youve only had one. My initial impression is that this beer is somewhat overrated. I thought there was an underlying-- albeit subtle-- cardboard flavor going on in the finish. Overall, not bad. But nothing special.

pours bright golden with a ncie white head, some retention and lacing. bready, spicy and lightly toasted maltiness, few tropical and citrusy notes in the aroma. dry herbal-grassy and peppery notes. clean yeast action and subtle fruitiness. bright carbonation, light body - never watery even with its low abv, dry, crisp herbal-grassy-citrusy finish. complex. highly drinkable. impressed!

My Bottom Line :  
This lagers intricate spicy and fruity hop nose relax in a prickly, lean mouthfeel where soft cereal flavors serve as a foundation for merriment.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A sheet of foam tops the misty straw blond.
-The finish is a tad forgettable.
-The flavor profile doesnt seem as deep as the aroma?
-This beer is meant for a krug.
-If you like this, Germany has a few hundred beers of the same caliber!

Bottles.
Golden and hazy. Nose of german malts, really low bitterness. i get some tangerines and biscuit. Taste is pretty bitter, feels like its full of adjuncts. A hint of salt and lemon zest.

Bottle, 08/03/2013. Golden pour, pillowy white head on the surface, lacing clinging to the glass, champagne bubbles. Aroma is cereal, toasted biscuit, lager yeast with citrus, grassy hop cone. Taste is toasted cereal, light lemon and citrus hoppiness, grassy finish. Light, crisp body. Definitely pretty tasty for a light lager, could knock back a few of these.
Bottle at Monmouth Park tasting. Pours clear gold with off white head. Nose and taste of yeasty lemon, light malt, citrus, spice and grain. Medium body. Crisp.
Hazy amber/gold color; Medium body; Aroma of malt, & hops/grain; Flavor of malt, hops, grain, and some citrus notes; Crisp finish; Nicely balanced for a lager; Solid.

Pours to a clear golden body with lots of carbonation and a lasting white head. The aroma and flavor is a floral/saaz/mango combination. The palate is medium bodied and clean with a perfect carbonation. Excellent, and a very good lager. I thought this was fantastically produced.
I am in love with this brewery. A "simple" pale lager tastes so damn good. I could drink this all day. Pleasant hoppiness to it with soft carbonation and crisp malt bill.
Bottle in Bernardston, VT. Golden body with thin head. Nose is sweet, hoppy. Taste is cory, sweet, toasty and hoppy. Nice citrus notes too. Smooth texture and finish. Enjoyable.

Golden pour w/ a tall fairly dense white head w/ some good lacing. Light floral hop aroma a bit of a munich aroma a tiny trace of soapiness and a hint of white pepper. Avg palate. Flavor is lightly spicy floral hop w/ a touch of white pepper. Easy sessionable and enjoyable.

Bottle thanks to Dave. Pours out a clear golden color with a big fluffy white head and a ton of carbonation. Aroma is of sweet cereal, bread, floral hops. Taste is clean with grainy cereal, light citrus, floral hops, clean and solid.

16.9oz bottle, thanks to Mike L. Mostly clear golden orange color. Good thin pillowy slightly off-white head. Some foamy lace. Lighter body. Good smooth light to moderate carbonation. Lightly dry in the finish. Very easy to drink, perfect for a session beer. Nice bready malt base, balanced with a satisfying bit of lightly grassy hop. Some elusive, subtle complexity to this that you know is there, but is hard to decipher. Its all very well blended and put together. Nice lighter bitter taste. Very satisfying session lager. Great to wash my Subway down with.
Lightly sour, super dry, very effervescent. Pretty high in alcohol for a session beer at 4.5

500ml bottle from radarsock. Poured a nice looking straw yellow body with an averge sized bright white foamy head. Aroma is bread and biscuit, dough, light citrus hops. Palate is full of fizzy lively carbonation and a light body that finishes with a carbonation kick. Flavor is clean and crisp but a bit boring, grains and crusts dominate with a slight faint hint of perhaps dry lemon rind and yeast. Meh, no idea why everyone is rating this one so high.

500ml bottle in a lager glass.  Pours golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of floral and lightly citrusy hops plus a nice light, maltiness.  Flavor the same with a good blend of the light elements.  Average to light texture.  A great beer for the style.

ottle thanks to rob paul, thanks bud yur grate! YEllow with a white head. Doesnt smell much like an abbey belgium beer. As a lager, its good. A bit too aggressive with the bitterness, some enjoyable fruit notes complimented the light body. Mildly bitter finish, very clean. Pour one out for your buddy before obama taxes your dead doge.

Tap at Kinsale in Boston. Pours straw clear with some head and lots of lacing. Nose is floral. Aromas of biscuit, some yeast, light grassy hops and a pilsner type bite to the finish. Tastes were light sweet and  light bitter. Light enough body with lively carbonation. Nice clean beer with good depth and complexity for the style.

Clean, easy drinking lager with a nice fruity hop quality to it.  I am not certain of the freshness of my bottle but I imagine this beer is even more special when on draft.  Also, amazing value at 3 dollars for a pint bottle.

50cl bottle pours a clear gold with some frothy, white head.  nose is malt, lightly hoppy, lemon, light pine, orange, bread.  Smells like a watered down IPA.  Flavor is malty, orange, light caramel, bread with honey.  Medium bodied, dry finish.

Fantastic lager beer. This beer is what a lager should be. jacks abby does what few breweries do, celebrate the glory of lagers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

phenomenal lagers coming from Jacks Abby.  This is what  Lager should taste like.  Beautiful fresh subtle grain aromas and flavors, restrained-yet-present hop crispness, and a slightly sweet classic German yeast profile.
Pours clear golden. Nose is toasted maltz, honey, rich sweet malt. Flavor is rich malts, honey. Sweet finish. light but full body. good beer.

hazy gold, puffy white head, light lacing, thin ring. Sparkling nose is doughy, light toast, faint grass bitterness. Pleasant. Flavor has more bite, grassy bitterness with dough and light grain, long finish despite thin body. Second to HF Florence for the night.
50cl bottle.  Large white head atop crystal clear apple juice body.  Aroma is medium sweet, straw, some bread.  Taste is medium sweet, bread, some straw,  Light body, fairly clean.

Bottle thanks to Alex! Pours a clear pale gold with a white head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma has a combination of grassy hops, earthy grains and toast. Flavor starts with grassy hops but finish is more of hay, grain and a bit of toast.

great lager for super bowl. Golden with well retained head. Aroma of sour dough toast. Little metal but also hinted grass hops. Crisp body with biscuit taste. Mild bitter finish. jacks abby is quickly climbing to one of my go to brews.

In short: A no-style toasted and grassy golden thirst lager of exceptional quality.  Wow!
How: Bottle 500ml.  Consumed fresh two weeks after purchase from the brewery, bottle given to me by lushawn, thanks a lot Shawn.
The look: Crystal clearn golden-blond body topped by a medium white with medium retention.
In long: Nose is has a pleasant sun toasted hay, that fresh lager smell that I can never put into words, grassy noble hops.  Taste is an exercise in freshness, the true lager character coming through, boiled egg whites (Im the only one on the planet who gets this from some clean lagers), grainy cereals with a definite freshly picked sun dried hay character, good amount of grassy noble hops, a light touch of caramel.  Finish has a mild bitterness and toastiness and dry grass add a dryness that makes you want to go back for another sip right away.  Full chewy body with bubbles that are a bit too hard.  Except for beers like Heater Allen Coastal and a few others I havent had an American bottled thirst lager that was as satisfying this Jabby Brau.  I cant wait for the tickers to start sharing a bottle between 6 of them and thrash the score of this fine fine beer. What a highly drinkable beer, a 500ml bottle just wasnt enough, but for a good thirst lager like this one I dont think Id find any bottle size big enough if it doesnt require two handles.

Bottle @ home via trade with Ernesto987. Thanks a bunch! Pours a hazy golden appearance with a nice creamy khaki head. Sweet toasty malty, cracker, light lemon, a bit herbal, grassy hoppy aroma. Slightly sweet, toasted cracker malty, grassy, straw labor with a fairly balanced finish. A touch sweet and slightly pedestrian but a really solid lager and probably a good session beer.

Bottle from gn0sis. Pours light gold with a nice white head. Slight lacing. Very light citrus aroma. Taste is lightly citrus, a bit of grass, lemon, gumball, Very fresh and drinkable. Definitely nothing offensive. But also nothing outstanding.
Yes pretty much perfect for what it is.  Would make you want to drink a normal lager again.  Nice assertive malt base with enough slight bitterness to make it bubble on by.
Bottle at lunch with friends in foxboro. Pours golden with white fluffy head.   Nose of light citrus and yeast. Tastes of lemon, grains, yeast, malt, grass, and its crisp. A delightful session brew

500ml bottle courtesy of the lu.  halfway through this friggin shipment... pours a somewhat hazy, mildy transparent golden orange brown hue where on top rests a thin soapy white head that reduces down to an even thinner wispy film... aroma of soft pale grains, herbal, with what seems to be a citrusy tangerine fruit note to go with the aforementioned.  def more of an amped up lager with a distinct unique nose. a little doughy with aspirin notes coming through at points but seem to subside... light toasted grains throughout, much like the aroma, orange citrus through the middle, and finishes off on a grassy bitter bent.  really like the amount of flavor that they pack into this little guy.  a little sweet at times but the light bitter dry finish more than makes up for that.
Poured from a 500ml bottle. Huge sweet pilsner malt, grain, dough, floral, fruity. This is a great lager.

500ml bottle into a large pint glass. 

A - Pours a very clear light amber body. A bit darker than I was expecting. Soapy white foam with excellent lacing and retention.

S - Pilsner malt, grassy and herbal hops, and some faint fruits. Bready aroma. Very inviting. 

T - Bready malts, grass, lemon rind, and piney hops. Very pilsner like with some hop bitterness. Mouth feel is medium bodied with a dry finish. Has a residual graininess quality to it. 

O - A tasty and unique beer. Very sessionable and very flavorful. Craft lagers, they do work!

A very likeable beer. Goldish//bronze color, frothy head that sticks. Malty, earthy hops, almost bread-like. A little spice tingle on the mouthfeel. Nice initial hit of hops, then some malt comes to play. Local brewery to me, great philosophy - looking forward to trying more offerings. Enjoyable and drinkable beer, which I guess makes it sessionable?

Style et résumé: Premium lager américaine de qualité.  
Comment:  Bouteille de 16oz. bue lors de la dégustation Armand en compagnie de Pierre-Luc, Julien et Pat le slovaque. 
Description: Bière dorée un peu plus foncée que la moyenne de lager. Le nez a des arômes classiques de lager avec des houblons nobles et des céréales. En bouche le liquide se laisse couler, cest facile mais les saveurs ne sont pas absentes pour autant. Il y a du grain, des céréales avec du houblon noble. Très réussi. 
Note:  6+/10

Pours a crystal clear deep medium golden color with a huge fluffy white head that sticks around forever. Smells of bready pilsner and sweet Munich malts with a floral and earthy hop aroma as well as a spicy component that reminds me of wheat. The flavor is earthy hops up front with a bit of bready malt beneath it. Middle and finish showcase some earthy spicy wheat and hops. Medium to light body with a moderate level of carbonation and a slick almost spicy resinous mouthfeel. This was not at all what I was expecting, but I thoroughly enjoyed it just the same. Jacks Abby continues to impress me with their offerings.

Une dégustation offerte par Julien et Pier-Luc.  Une robe dorée avec sa coiffe blanche.  Des arômes vibrants de houblons en herbes et en fleurs.  Une base maltée mielleuse qui semble bien connaître son rôle.  Sur les papilles, une force houblonnée qui nest pas la même.  Des céréales et des grains qui simposent avec une évidente fraîcheur.  Une bouche qui nest pas de moyenne densité.  Des bulles actives et une texture qui me semble être à la limite huileuse.  Une finale dans laquelle se manifeste un écho de notes amères.  Super facile à boire.

Bottle late night after the VIP session at Hill Farmsteads Harvest Festival.  Pours a clear golden amber with a thin white head.  Grainy lager yeast on the nose, toast.  Soft sweet grain and malt.  Toast, grainy.  Gentle bitterness, toast into the finish.

Bottle. Clear gold pour with frithy white head. Aroma is quite fruity, really nice balance of different malts, light caramel, very light roast/nuttiness, super subtle and fresh. Taste is slightly sweet, definitely on the malty side of things, honey, caramel. Sick lager.

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to Matt for this one! Clear golden with a small persistent white head. Aroma of malt, grass, pilsner malt, american hops, citrus. Taste is crisp with grassy hints and near perfect malty backbone. Clean. Almost no bitterness. Thats a wonderful session lager! I could drink this every day.

Pours a light golden straw color with a couple fingers of fizzy foam that laces out and dissipates. On the nose its basic clean malty bready notes touched with the slightest touch of floral hoppy notes. On the palate this beer really nails it... good front end citrus hops come through with a great medium mouthfeel that tingles with bubbles as it falls into a earthy malty mid-palate. Light crisp and a beautiful session beer...

1 pint 0.9oz. Purchased at Julios Liquors.  Used a pint and it does look like a normal lager. However, that is where the comparisons end. The nose is bursting with citrus hops with noticeable pilsner malt. Taste follows suit. This is exactly as advertised. Low bitterness that you could easily drink very large amounts of. In the world of lagers, this is high class.

Bottle from Joke! .5 liter. Im struck by how perfect it looks. Ive never seen such a crystal clear beer. The rest leaves a little to be desired. Wheres the unexpected malty finish? Flavorful? Yes. Memorable? Not so much.

The pour is a clear yellow color with a white head.  A very good hoppiness to the nose.  Citrus and floral hops dominate up front.  Sweet biscuit malt comes through as the hops fade away.  A nice mild sweetness on the palate which is complemented nicely by the citrusy and floral hop profile.  Very light bitterness and just a very good beer all around.
Citrus, spice, and pine hops in the aroma.  Flavor starts sweet and spicy, with some fruit and flower.  Finish is sweet and spicy with more flowery hops.  Really good.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 oh wow.  real real nice.  crisp fresh grass and grapefruit hop balanced nicely by a rustic, herbal, pilsner malt backing.   awesome session lager.    quality on par with that of heater allen.    will drink again soon.  finally found my goto new england session beer.

Very smooth beer. The hoppy aroma is appealing. Smooth taste of malt and really light. Very easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear with a white head tht leaves a slight ring. Nose is hoppy. Palate is hoppy even in the aftertaste. Malt comes through int he body. Jacks specilaizes in laghers and this is a good example of their craft.
Really great sessionable beer here.  Crisp refreshing citrus and a nice pale, cracker malty bite.  Just a well done beer.  These guys are really impressing me.
Jabby brau is awesome. Huge citrusy aromas. Clean and Finishes like a lager.

Poured into a perfect pint. Big thanks to Dope for this.

3.5 A: Mildly hazed light orange color. Two fingers of frothy off-white head. Retention is average and a bit of lacing if left.

4.0 S: Quite hoppy. Herbal, earthy, and mildly floral. Grainy malts underneath with a light, neutral malt sweetness. Simple, but pleasant.

4.0 T: Good bit of hop flavor as well with more earth anf floral and a bit less herbal. Low bitterness. Grainy maltiness with a sweet finish.

4.0 M: Light to lighter medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Clean and crisp, quite crisp.

4.0 D: Solid, hoppy lager. I can see myself putting down a few of these while watching some NFL games.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-24-2012 00:07:20

Bottle.  It is a very interesting beer melding the big pungent floral and tropical fruit hop aromas of an proper ipa with good American lager grassy aromas and sweet sort of crisp lemon and grain character. fairly conventional lager mouthfeel.  More interesting than awesome but good for a session hop fix.

Bottle. Pours a bright orange color with a faint bubbly head. Nose is light grassy hops up front with light dry straw notes behind. Palate is full and crisp though a light stickiness in the finish and a coated tongue. Flavors of hearty biscuits and grains, grass and hay, light honey and a dry finish.
This is a truly pilsner. Medium body with intense malt character, hiding hops. I really appreciated this beer.

Dry toasty malt and crisp clean noble hops. Light fruit acidity suggested. Finishes with a peppery spice on the tongue. Simple but decent complexity for a sessionable lager. Really tasty easy drinking beer.

Bottle purchased at Julios. As always, my local brewer has produced another quality beer. Jack and his bros have not let me down yet. Though this is more mainstream than their other offerings it is still a quality beer and a good one to have on hand for the less obsessed beer drinkers out there who lean toward the macro lagers of the world (except this one is actually good).
Pours deep gold into a Sam glass. Bright white head with good retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Deep pine aromas. Crisp with sweet caramel and pine front to back with a lasting resin finish.

It was the Hoponius that first attracted me to Jacks Abby, but the Jabby Brau is equally impressive.  It has the all the balance and crisp hop flavors but more mass appeal that the more bitter JA offerings.  The perfect beer to bring to a party full of Coors Light and PBR fans without disappointing the craft beer crowd.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2012 Rated 3.7 on 12/29/2011. On tap at Meadhall - Cambridge, MA. Aroma is a pungent, aromatic grassy hop quality. Strong and clean. Flavors back off the hop bitterness and flavor and give a reliable, straightforward light maltiness. Fresh, drinkable, and with a fun edge of hops to keep "session" interesting.


Rated 4.0 on 4/19/2012. 500mL Bottle, purchased at Julios Liquors - Westborough. How many hoppy beers can you say have been better in the bottle than on tap? I dont know what these guys did, but this one certainly got better! Wow. Big fresh pungent aroma. Wonderfully built malt base, clean and light. These guys are masters of hoppy lagers and I love it. I cant get enough of this stuff right now!
